Session Overview If A is symmetric and positive definite, there is an orthogonal matrix Q for which A = Q_Λ_QT. Here Λ is the matrix of eigenvalues. Singular Value Decomposition lets us write any matrix A as a product U_Σ_VT where U and V are orthogonal and Σ is a diagonal matrix whose non-zero entries are square roots of the eigenvalues of ATA. The columns of U and V give bases for the four fundamental subspaces.
